subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unit testing Contexts
msgSnippet: ... My best estimate is 1250-1750 hours. But, you know, I really don t regret any of the work involved, except maybe the EJB chapter. That was painful. -- J.
messageBody:
Simon Chappell wrote:

> On 8/14/06, Shinobu Kawai <shinobu.kawai@...
> <mailto:shinobu.kawai%40gmail.com>> wrote:
> *snip*
> > That's a very good book. I'm thinking of taking it to work today.
> *snip*
> > ## And I sure hope he's heard of it, too. :)
>
> I was one of the technical reviewers for the book and I think it
> rocks; J.B. rocks as well. Also, while I *know* he's heard of it, I
> suspect that some days he wishes he hadn't! (Do you know how much work
> is involved in creating anything of that magnitude?)

My best estimate is 1250-1750 hours.

But, you know, I really don't regret any of the work involved, except
maybe the EJB chapter. That was painful.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
